title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: The interview has a calm environment, and the interviewer is very patient and approachable and is open to concerns and questions. The employer is also soft spoken and does not appear intimidating
Interview Questions: What are your nursing experience?

title: Assistant Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great very comfortable and down to earth. The interviewer was nice and not intimidating even allowed me to do a share day with company. I would do it all again.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? And what made you apply for position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted in a professional and organized manner. I felt as though I received great feedback on the position I interviewed for. I was able to shadow and see the floors I interviewed for.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were moderate in difficulty.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at LifeBridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Impossible to schedule, constant rescheduling at the time of the interview. Poor candidate experience all around. Months of back and forth and then rescheduling at the time of the interviews. Overall, truly disappointing to have your time disrespected and this is only during the candidacy process- not even as an employee.
Interview Questions: General/ average interview questions asked

title: ER RN, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: A conversation with questions. One nurse, one room and I. I was told to wear scrubs to the interview. Scheduled out about three weeks from submitting application. I was told about the highlights of the ER and achievements.
Interview Questions: Where do you see you self in five years and explaining resume

title: IMC Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at LifeBridge Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a hiring event in the auditorium, so I could interview with the hiring managers of the unit I was interested. Met with hiring manager, answered some questions, they described the job. shadowed a nurse in the unit  of interest.
Interview Questions:
1. Background about yourself
2. most challenging clinical experience

title: Surgical Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I applied 8/13 and I received a phone interview invite on 8/17 where I spoke with the Hr rep about the position. Shortly after that I received offer to interview face to face with the manager, physician and team lead. The process was very smooth and quick and I proudly accepted the offer. 

Whole process took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions:
What are some of your hobbies out side of work? 
What interest you about the position?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at LifeBridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy they go into detail and they help as much  as possible. They are great and they are family oriented and they give people a lot of opportunities to succeed and move up in the hospital.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you are the best fit?

title: Health Care Mananagement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied back in the middle of June. By the end of June, I received an email request to set up a time to discuss the position. She sent my information to her manager in HR. We had a 5 minutes conversation confirming my credits via phone. A week later in July, I had a 10-minute phone interview with the immediate manager about my skills. After that, I waited about a month to be told I got the job. Three-month wait I'm grateful for the new opportunity but I am also glad I had another job in the mean time as well.
Interview Questions: Can you balance multiple tasks at one time? Can you work independently? Describe your computer skills?

title: Outreach Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at LifeBridge Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied via website, contacted by Human Resources  for initial background informational interview.  HR set interview up.  Had in person interview with three people.  Questions appropriate.  Got back to me in reasonable time.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you’re a good fit for this job?

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Difficult but rewarding . The manager was very pleasant and I was able to get my second interview the same day . It was a very seamless process..I was made a offer in my second interview.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for Lifebridge

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very unprofessional. Interviewer called an hour before scheduled interview time. Interviewer seemed like she did not want to preform the interview. Most of the questions had nothing to do with the position.
Interview Questions: How much do want to make between $20.00 and $26.00 an hour.

title: Recovery Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Reisterstown, MD) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the Recovery Specialist I position on their website and the next week I got a phone call from a recruiter that scheduled my interview.  This was a position with Practice Dynamics Inc. which handles the medical billing for LifeBridge. I interview was really laid back.  I interviewed with the manager of the department and the direct supervisor.
Interview Questions: What insurance companies was I aware of?

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with three people they all asked good questions and allowed me to ask my questions. it wasn't bad it was comfortable. Be prepared to tell them about your skills and what value you bring as a new employee to the company.
Interview Questions: What ideas did you implement at your last employer and did it stick?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Worst interview experience I've ever had. First off, one of the main directors had the wrong resume with him and thought I was someone else entirely. He was asking me about work experience I've never had and someone else had to correct him in the middle of his long expose.
One of the other panel members struck up a conversation with me about how all Bachelor's degrees are a scam. I was literally just about to graduate with one.
Interview Questions: Are you okay with fulfilling a jack-of-all-trades type of role?

title: Practice Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with an HR rep, she gave me a brief overview of the organization and of the benefits of the position I was applying for, then asked me a few basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time when you had a very difficult customer that you couldn't make happy?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the manager over the phone to discuss job and my work history.  I later was asked to do an interview w/ a panel of nurses and manager of the dept.
Interview Questions: Have you ever advocated for a patient to receive vital healthcare services?

title: Emergency Psych Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at LifeBridge Health
Interview Descriptions:
I received a bogus email stating, " After much consideration and review, we have decided to continue our search for another candidate whose qualifications and experience best match the needs of the department." I find this insulting to say the least given that I have over 7 years of experience doing the exact same job, and I currently do the same exact job on PRN basis at another hospital. 

I would suggest that HR carefully review each applicant's qualifications thoroughly because it is evident that this does not occur! I will NEVER apply again!
Interview Questions: No questions asked.

title: Gna Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied got a phone call, interviewed, orientation,  than worked the floor. It wasn't bad at all  I really enjoyed the environment also working with the patients Human resources were very helpful
Interview Questions: How did you hear about this position

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied in February and got called for an interview 3 weeks later. I met with Hiring manager for that dept, and almost two weeks later had a second interviews.  I hadnt heard anything for 3
 Weeks after that and then they called to offer me the position. By then i had accepted a job somewhere else, i assumed they picked somebody.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multi tasking

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very casual interview. None of the typical interview questions were asked, I was shown around the hospital and was introduced to the staff. I was able to eat lunch with the other RDs and was told about daily operations and benefits available. Overall it was a very positive and easy interview!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very fast and easy. I was called soon after I applied to come in for an interview with HR then I interviewed with my soon to be practice manager and lead medical assistant. I was pretty much hired on the spot then went to orientation within 1-2 weeks after interviewing
Interview Questions: how do you handle difficult situations?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: After responding to my inquiry I was informed that the department was in transition, so we had difficulty pinpointing a date.  After interviewing  with the Administrators I interviewed with staff & professionals. It was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Management style?

title: Community Health and Outreach Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two-part interview with both HR and someone in the department. Very straightforward with basic behavioral questions.  No skills test. Took about 2 hours. Very casual atmosphere but do recommend over dressing.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the position. About a week later I was contacted to schedule a phone interview that Monday. That went well and they scheduled a face to face interview on Friday. I was offered the position the same day.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions asked

title: Financial Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: You are contacted for an interview to discuss experience, educational background and work ethic for the position. You then meet one on one with the manager of the department for discussion pertaining the position, qualifications and experiences. Upon completion of the interview if your considered, you will be contacted and offered the position and salary offer.
Interview Questions: What experiences and qualification do I have that would match the position's needs

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted the same day I submitted my application by the Director hiring for the position.  After a brief phone screen, we scheduled a face to face interview for later that same week.  After successful completion of the face to face interview with the hiring Director, I was told I would have to interview with human resources since that was usually the first step and was required.  I was able to interview with HR over the phone about a week later so I did not have to go back in.  I received my offer about two weeks later.
Interview Questions: Based on what I've shown you, what would your recommendations be for improvements.

title: Guest Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Randallstown, MD) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: easy interview; interview and offer within 2 weeks of applying. group interview with directors of different departments . asked basic interview questions like what are your strengths an weaknesses
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Guest Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview,  followed by in-person interview with Manager (and met co-workers), followed by interview with VP (due to position working directly with Executive Administration ). Also a writing sample was requested.
Interview Questions: How I would handle hypothetical situations.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: First phone with HR, then phone with Hiring manger, then group interview. Still waiting to hear results
Interview Questions: Tell me about your time management skills

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Leadership utilized behavioral interviewing questions throughout- as a current employee it was an opportunity for me to share experiences I had in a former career that were transferable to the position I was applying for.  As a current employee of the organization, I knew those I was interviewing with and had an opportunity to ask more detailed questions about the department, position, and culture of the division.
Interview Questions: Share with me a time when you were faced with a deadline and how you prioritized competing tasks.

title: Rehabilitation Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at LifeBridge Health (Baltimore, MD) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed with HR Recruiter, Director of Rehabilitation, and Rehabilitation Team Leaders.
Went to Occupational Health for pre-employment. Was given At-A-Glance of benefit. Was given a tour of the hospital and the Rehab unit.
Interview Questions:
How well I work with other?
My experience in the Rehabilitation Department at my previous job.
How well I work under pressure.
